posts.content:
monkey knuts wrote:Better with young-uns, or without????


Your call, Matthew and Amanda will be laying on stuff for the children. Each child will have a Seedlings T Shirt and can tie dye it, the Scalextric track will be up and running as before and there will be other activities including a film show while the AGM is going on This year if you have a van/car you wish to bring and race I am sure it will be possible.

Information about what is going on for the children will be posted at the gate and by the marquee.

See you all there

Hi john, I'm going sometime on Friday am from marlborough.

I'm off all day tomorrow (Friday) and I'm free to convoy up with you if you like. I agree with the earlier suggestion on A34, A43, A5. Followed a couple last year part way who went that way and I went up to Warwick. They were much quicker than us.

Anyway we could meet at chievely services on A34, M4 junction on your way and close to us if you like. If that works please just pm me.

the 2 club members with me -one is having mechanicals and unsure and the other is coming up Saturday afternoon. So please just let me know and if not I'll trundle up and see you there.

carl
Disaster at work!!! Been called in for the weekend . Not a happy bunny!
Will be there on Sunday Awesome

Paul66spliy wrote:Will be there on Sunday Awesome

We're leaving tomorrow afternoon.
Took my lad for his first cruze today and he was hooked... Loved all the attention and the bus was mobbed outside Pizza Hut
Hope to catch up on Sunday. Never been to Stanford Hall.

I came up from hungerford on the Wantage Road - Oxford - A44 - across M40 at jtn 10. Passed Silverstone - A5. Lovely route. No traffic.

Sent from my GT-I9300 using Tapatalk 2
